page.title: 15 HIGHAM PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Higham school was built in 1847 and has recently been extended in order to cater for the growing population of the village. There are now 212 children at Higham school. There are seven classes now compared with one class when the school was first built. The school used to have a P.T.A but this has recently become an "association of friends". Music plays a very big part within the school. Rehearsals for the regional choir festival are held there each year and many of the pupils at the school have special tuition in violin, recorders and cello. The school is in an attractive country setting and attracts children from a large area.
